title: I messed up Thuderbird, can't import old profiles etc
content:
I desperately (sobbing here) need someone to hold my hand and walk me through this!!! I uninstalled the newest version (115) and installed the previous version (102) because of an outgoing mail problem. It gave me a warning that the newer version changed my profiles and it's not compatible so I downloaded the new version again. The import screen doesn't look anything like what it says in the help files. I don't have an option for importing from a previous version.

Please rescue me. I run a nonprofit and I have deadlines and meetings next week that I was supposed to make arrangements for and I've been dealing with this for almost a week.
creator: flwildlife

title: Marking a message as Junk deletes it but does not move to teh newxt message
content:
Recently upgraded to Thunderbird 115.4.2

I have it set that when I delete a message it is marked as deleted and Thunderbird moves on to the next message - I then Compact Folders later.

It used to be that when I marked a message as junk (by clicking the Junk button) it would delete the message then move to the next message. Now it deletes the message, but the same message is highlighted, and I have to go back to the messages list and click the next message.

Also, Thunderbird used to make sure the message list showed a few messages below the highlighted message. Now it lets the highlight go to the bottom of the window - so I have to scroll down to see the next message.

So where I used to have 1 UI operation (click Junk) I now have 3 UI operations (click Junk, scroll down, click next message).

Are there any options to restore the old behaviour?
creator: dp20130225

title: Thunderbird has developed a mind of it's own re trash, spam and junk determination
content: In the last couple of weeks Thunderbird started dumping normal emails I regularly receive into my junk or trash folders. I'd been using QuickFilters and Xpunge add ons with no problems, but thought disabling them might cure the problem. But, NO luck there. Please help, else I must move to another email client. Thanx
creator: jhepting

title: Thunderbird lost passwords for att.net accounts so I can't send or receive emails
content:
This started two days ago and I've been searching the web for solutions, but all I get are outdated solutions that won't wonk on my current Thunderbird version 115.4.2. When I open the Thunderbird window, two smaller windows open asking for me to enter the passwords for the two att.net accounts. I assumed they meant my AT&T passwords but when I entered them they came back as "failed". I then tried the "master" password I put in several years ago (which I have never needed to re-enter) and that didn't work either. I am attaching a photo of what comes up when I open Thunderbird. You can see the two boxes that want me to enter the passwords but I have no idea what to enter. If it wasn't my master password or my AT&T passwords for each account, it must have been something I used when I installed Thunderbird ten years ago that somehow got deleted or lost.

I downloaded another email client to use temporarily until I get my Thunderbird fixed so I can not get my emails, but I hate this new client for a lot of reasons that are irrelevant here. I hate this new client and I need my Thunderbird back. Can anyone give me any idea on how to find the right password or to change the password so it will work again?
creator: pfw51

title: no longer downloading emails
content: Hello. I've been using Thunderbird now for, oh, I don't even know how many years, a long time, currently version 102.15.1 (64-bit). But, I have not been able to connect to any servers to send/receive mail since October 31. It will just hang like it's trying to connect, but nothing happens except for the little bouncing dot that shows up while you're connecting and downloading (don't know how to better describe the dot, but that's what's in the image, bounces left-to-right beside Inbox). I use it to connect to yahoo, google, comcast, but all of them have failed to connect since Oct. 31, though I am able to connect to them all through the browser. I've tried disabling vpn and firewalls, individually and together, but doesn't have any effect. Pulling up task manager, Thunderbird's CPU and memory usage fluctuates a little so it's not like the program itself is frozen but no network connectivity reported for the program. Any help or ideas to try to get Thunderbird working again would be muchly appreciated. Thank you in advance :)
creator: ghostinthemachine7331

title: Multiple gmail tags as multiple conversations in different folders in Thunderbird on IMAP
content:
Hello everyone,

I have recently downloaded and installed Thunderbird 3 days ago, and still not able to use it, because it is downloading and downloading and downloading... seems never finishing downloading, slows down my laptop, and increasing used disc space.

For the beginning added 3 gmail e-mail addresses, and 1 yahoo mail.

Google mails are really old one of them is 32,22 GB and I have a well thought hierarhical folder structure marked with google mail tags. I faced with the problem, than every conversation which has more labels (tags) is downloading as many times to the Thunderbird folder as much tags it has, so lot of emails are duplicated or even tripled.

Single conversation with multiple tags is downloading multiple times and it is slow and annoying and meaningless usage of disk space.

How can I avoid multiply messages on my local folder?

I set to use IMAP, because I thought it is the solution to keep the messages in the gmail too, and it fits for me before I will be familiar with Thunderbird, it's a kind of security for keep my messages safe.

Sorry if this setting is easy for everyone else, but I am searching for solution and i am still not able to find out how to make it work. I thought it will make my life easier with see all my e-mail accounts all together in one place, but if not possible to set properly, seems just wasting my time.

Thank you.
creator: szeszterke

title: Thunderbird Emails.
content:
Good evening.

Thunderbird updated today (12 November 2023). It has re-arranged my Local folders, splitting contents randomly into two Local Folders (read and blue labels). I don't seem to have lost anything, but the layout is hard to work with. I've tried to move folders from one local folder to another, but this cannot cope with subfolders. Additionally, when I open 'Trash' deleted Emails are not appearing - instead there is a list of folders that were previously in my Local folder. And for some reason, the new TBird has resurrected all the Emails I had previously deleted, and then deleted from 'Trash', going back for 14 years. The originals of these are, or maybe were, on a BT server - I am still a BT customer. How can I recover my previous Inbox Local folder layout without doing any damage please? Can I safely restore the previous settings before today's update? Thanks.

DAW

title: New thunderbird overkill has ruined it.
content: Don't like the look of the new Thunderbird. Just too much of everything. It's just for sending and receiving emails. Now it is messing up, which it never did before after 10 or more years. Emails that I have moved to folders keep coming back to my inbox when I reopen the program. So before I get told that the settings in my pop account are wrong and I need to change this or that, like I've seen other people told. NO.....! It worked fine until some meat head wrote new code for this new 115.whatever version, and thought that a new fancy task bar was more important then getting mail. And this goof ball needs to fix it................Thank You Very Much, Craig P.S. Yes I give $ to Mozilla.
